headline: Baked Chicken Wings
description: These baked chicken wings are easy to prep with a spicy coating, then baked to crispy perfection for a delicious way to prepare chicken wings.

video.description: Yes, you can get crispy chicken wings from the oven.
video.name: Baked Chicken Wings

name: Baked Chicken Wings
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Combine olive oil, garlic, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a large, resealable bag; seal and shake to combine. Add chicken wings; reseal and shake to coat. Arrange chicken wings on a baking sheet.
Cook chicken wings in the preheated oven until crisp and cooked through, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: The prep work is easy. I let my wings marinate overnight. While your wings are baking, make some celery sticks and get your favorite dip ready. These wings taste excellent.

I didn't use a bag. I just rubbed the wings with olive oil first in a bowl. I added a couple drops of liquid smoke to the olive oil, I couldn't taste that at all. I added Morton's salt to the seasoning, which made it to salty. But the flavor was really good, I also added a little cornstarch to try to crisp them, but I don't think that did anything. I then broiled the wings on low for about 10 minutes to get them to brown a little after the 40 minutes at 400 degrees. My five year old loves them and that's who I cooked them for, so win win!

I marinated the wings for about 2 hours before cooking. My husband is not a big fan of chicken wings, but really liked these. I love chicken wings and enjoy trying different wing recipes. I thought these were just ok.
I made these and I sure will do it again. It will be one of my favorites.
I modified the spices a bit (that's what I do), still, the rest of the instructions worked great. It was very simple, crispy and tasty.
I made a batch as is without the crushed cloves of garlic because I didn't have any. Also made a batch without the chili powder adding grated Parm cheese. Big hit. No more fried wings for this hous.

I’ve made these style wings a few times. A few tweaks here and there like adding some smoked paprika to the spice mix and little to no salt. Montreal chicken and steak seasoning garlic and herb and smoked paprika topped with fresh Italian herbs. Made them a year ago today at work during a nasty snow storm. Making them now at home. Great taste. Great crisp. Perfect recipe to doctor up to your own likeness.
I added teryaki and sesame to 2 wings. Excellent! Thank you. Oh I added bread crumbs!
Excellent wings. I substituted blackened chicken seasoning for the chili powder (since I didn’t have any) and it was amazing! A keeper! 45 minutes tops. An hour would burn.
Absolutely delicious!
SO tender! Will be making again and again!

I'm giving this 3 stars because of how nice and crispy the wings came out, and for the simplicity of the recipe. That being said, that was about all I liked about this. There really was very little flavor as written. If I make it again, I'll really have to play with some spices or add some sauce to give it a little more kick.

Easy and delicious!

I didn't have chili power so I used peprika instead, and I added more garlic. Everyone loved it.
Very quick and easy. This went well with a small, easy, pasta salad.
Simple to fix and very tasty.

I’m not a “reviewer,” but these deserve to be praised. I used large, whole wings and needed to double the recipe putting 4 wings in each bag. I also let them marinate for a while. They were incredible.
Loved this recipe
Made exactly as written and these turned out crispy and delicious. I used party wings so I did reduce the cooking time.
These tasted AMAZING! So tender even though the cook time seemed long. Highly recommend making these

This really has become my go to chicken wing recipe for cooler weather (preferring to grill my wings whenever possible). I add a dash (ok, a couple dashes) of hot sauce for our spice-loving palates, but otherwise, follow the recipe exactly. Good stuff!
Have made these 2 or 3 times. Good for doing a more traditional wing. Bake as the recipe calls for then toss in your favorite wing sauce

This is a great recipe - very easy! I put the 'marinade' in a bag, added the wings and put them in the frig. When I was ready, I put them in the oven and they took about 45 minutes. I used chicken flats and drumettes.
I used drumsticks instead since that’s a family preference. The seasoning was spot on. If you like to add some heat, sriracha sauce pairs nicely. Great for get togethers!

I was surprised and thrilled at how easy this recipe was and how tasty the wings are! First time I ever made wings in the oven (and I've been cooking for over 30 years); now I make them often. I somewhat double the recipe, putting about 20 wings in a bowl. Then I drizzle olive oil over top, no measuring (no need to use as much as recipe calls for). Next I add the spices, tweaking amounts a bit according to personal preference, then garlic and stir it all with a wooden spoon; lay them on parchment paper on a cookie sheet and turn them over half way through baking. Total bake time 45-50 minutes. These are great in the winter when you don't want to grill in the cold. Takes minutes to prepare but tastes like you spent all day making them. Love this recipe!
I have made this so many times I could do it in my sleep. My bf likes the wings crispy crispy so I take them out at the hour but he does 1.5 hrs. Dip them in ranch or coat the
Made exactly as recipe. I enjoyed every bite. Great tasting wings, will make again.
didn't really care for

This is a great recipe! I’ve made it twice in two weeks. Both times, I’ve made two batches. One as the recipe calls for and one adding onion powder and Buffalo sauce as others have mentioned. Excellent either way! Yummy!!!

Very good! I always grill our wings but our grill was on the fritz so I opted for these oven baked wings. I admit that I added some Frank’s hot sauce mixed with soy sauce and cola and seasonings. I feel this is a recipe that can be made ones own depending on taste.
These were great! Used all ingredients as written. Marinated in a bowl for a few hours. Baked 50 minutes turning half way through. Used drumsticks. A nice Super Bowl treat.
These do get nice and crispy but I like them a bit hotter so I would defiantly add some hot sauce!
Made this for Super Bowl 55, but did it with drumsticks in lieu of wings.
Awesome recipe. I ended up doubling the ingredients and cooking for about 45 minutes at 400 but they turned out flavorful and crisp. Will be making them again for sure.
This is a great recipe. I’ve made it a couple times and it’s always a big hit.
Made these wings exactly to the recipe. Great addition to my wing section of my recipe book. Will be making these for a few long time’
We typically BBQ our wings, but it was cold outside and we decided to bake them instead. One thing that surprised me was that they took an entire hour to cook. Good recipe, we all enjoyed it.
Extremely tasty!
Simply the best
I use this recipe frequently and love serve it with ranch, teriyaki, bbq, buffalo on side that way everyone can have their favorite sauce
yummy yummy
Really good recipe, very easy to do. I’ve never made wings before, but was craving them... Mission accomplished. Yes, I’m making this again (tonight, in fact).
Excellent flavor; super easy. We usually have 16 wings for this recipe and I find it the perfect amount. I line the baking sheet with foil for easy clean-up.
I added some cayenne as part of the chili pepper measurement. They were so good this is the 2nd time I've made them.
After baking, I dunk them in my favorite blended sauce and put them back on the rack. Then back in the hot oven for 5-7 minutes to let the sauce caramelize a bit.

I made my husband these chicken wings tonight. 1st time chicken wing cooker here and my husband loved them! So easy and delish. I did add onion powder like someone else suggested. Ive been known to not add enough spice so I added 1 more to each ingredient.
I loved the simplicity. I added quite a bit more garlic. should have added onion. Very tasty and just too easy.
Too plain

These were so good that my picky 8 year old son ate about five wings! The only suggestion Is make it to turn them over half way through as they were a little fatty n the undersides. I doubled the recipe and it was really yummy! It’s going to be a regular since it’s one of the few recipes my whole family likes!

Thought the chili powder overpowers the other flavors and did not like the taste. Chili is a strong spice and stays with you. Made wings a second time with a different dry ingredients marinade and enjoyed them much more. Cooking time and temp seems to be on target and wings came out perfect. Find a dry rub mix you like and use that and follow the instructions for cooking and you will have yummy wings !
We have a Gas Convection Oven and it can get mighty hot, after an hour these wings were not crispy, so we ramped it up to 425 degrees with better results.

I tripled the recipe for me, my husband and 2 teenaged sons. They were gone in 6 minutes. Everyone loved them. I had 2. I just loved that they enjoyed them so much. Next time I’ll put the wings on a cookie cooling rack while baking so they crisp more. I paired the wings with the easy corn on the cob recipe from here. Delicious!
These wings came out so good. Plus it made the whole house smell like I was a chef or something LOL. The only thing was, I added a little more salt. Otherwise...AWESOME and TASTY

These turned out delicious!! I did change one thing: During the last 10 minutes, I removed the chicken and basted 1/3 with Sweet Baby Rays BBQ, 1/3 with Frank's Red Hot Wings sauce, and kept 1/3 with the original seasoning. Definitely a keeper!
Cooking time and temp was perfect. Added a pinch of cayenne pepper.
The recipe was great! Its more like a buffalo wings as the spicy flavor kicks in. Very flavorful and tastes great. Will make again.
Super easy to make. I added chicken bouillon to the mixture delicious my three-year-old loves it! definitely making it again
This came out great. I do recommend rubbing the seasonings into the chicken for more flavor.
So easy and delicious!

In an attempt to be a bit more healthy, I made these for my GF, who is a huge fan of fried hot wings. She tried them fresh out of the oven and deemed them worthy before slathering them in Red's Hot Sauce and eating most of the wings....I got 3. I did not change the recipe at all, nor will I when I make these again and again.
Made this twice. found it dry at 50 min, 45 min duration was perfect. Also made a supplementary sauce of honey and olive oil and coated half the chicken wings at 40 min. which also turned out well.
Made this as is (maybe more minced onion bc we love garlic in my house). Simple, easy and yummy!
Baking wings at 375 for one hour came out perfect & by perfect I mean juicy and flavorful. My husband hates baked chicken however he ate these wings and loved them.
This was so easy! It was Delicious!!!!!!
The best chicken wings!!!
Delicious and easy to make
I quadrupled the recipe, used garlic salt instead of garlic powder and cut the chili powder in half and my family of 5 LOVED it!
This recipe was super easy and doubles nicely. I used it for my first time ever making wings and they turned out great. So good in fact my house of picky eaters asked me to make them again!
So yummy! I added smoked paprika was all. They were delicious!!

Wings comes out crispy and flavorful. Everyone loved them. I added smoked paprika in place of chili powder and added a little onion powder. I also used garlic salt in place of garlic powder. I cooked them on a foil lined cookie sheet and turned them after 30 minutes. They were crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. This recipe will definitely become part of our weekly rotation. My husband said these were the best wings that I ever cooked. Delicious
I was excited to make this. Trying to get away from fried foods but wanting it to be crispy and flavorful. Excellent choice. Wings turned out just as described. Will definitely do more often.

These were amazing I added onion powder and less garlic. After 55 minutes in the oven, I took them out and coated them in my personal barbecue sauce recipe and continued baking for 10 minutes! First time making chicken wings from scratch and it was a huge success

Thank you so much for posting this fool-proof recipe! I've never made chicken wings and this recipe (spices modified a bit for what was in the house) was used today to feed 4 of my in laws. Food is love and it was nice to share some during this stressful time. Thanks again :-)
I love this recipe. Very simple and easy to follow, but I add Old Bay seasoning to it as well and I double up on everything because I usually make way more than just 10 wings.

Whole family loves it, and very easy to make.
100% recommend
Delicious recipe
Easy, delicious, and scaleable.
good

Easy recipie to make w all the ingredients most homes have in their spice cabinet. Used this recipe on drum sticks. Came out great. Wife like them too. 
Always follow a new recipe as written before tinkering w it. Great as is.
So good! I needed up using the entire wing, and used this recipe for 6 of them and they turned out great! First time making wings and it couldn’t have been any easier or tastier!
We loved them. Used garlic powder instead of fresh. Healthier alternative to frying
Absolutely delish and so easy! I cooked the wings for about 1 hour and 15 minutes to make them extra crispy.
These were great. Lots of flavor. I did spread some Thai sauce over a few after they finished cooking. Liked them both with and without the sauce.
My girlfriend and loved them! They are very easy to make and tastes great. I already had the ingredients in the cupboard. Thank!

These wings are fantastic. Followed another review and added 2tbsp of Franks wing sauce and 1 tsp of onion powder. I cut the olive oil to 2 tbsp since I’m adding more liquid with the wing sauce. Another trick is after baking put them under the broiler on low for about 3 minutes, turn wings and broil for another 2-3 mins. Crispy and perfect.

I quadrupled the recipe for a group. It got rave reviews all night! I added creole seasoning to the mixture and let the chicken marinate for about 2 hrs in the refrigerator. Baked for an hour, but they were not crispy yet (probably because of the large quantity). I raised the temp to 425 and baked an additional 10-12 minutes and it turned out perfect.

This is the first time I made chicken wings and I will never use another recipe. This were so delicious and simple to make! They tasted like restaurant quality wings. I used a bowl and mixed them by hand and added other spices for more flavor. I also used cayenne pepper for the chili powder and decided to put in half the amount which was the perfect amount of spice. Can’t wait to make these again.
i added 1 teaspoon of onion powder and 1/4 sweet baby rays buffalo sauce, and OMG i’m in love
This has become my go to baked Chicken wings recipe I LOVE IT !!! DELICIOUS
Loved these wings and so easy. I followed the recipe exactly but marinated for 4-6 hours.
It was fall off the bone good, I followed the recipe and found it a little flat in taste. will definitely do it again, but will add some different spices to kick it up.
I loved the results ! Beautifully crisp on the outside, and tender inside. They were definitely a big hit and I will make these again.

This was fast & easy, but I didn't really like the spice mix. Is there a baked wings recipe for the air fryer or crockpot. I LOVE this site, & the magazine. I loved 2015 June July August turned me onto All Recipes! All those wonderful tomato dishes, & PIES!!! Yum yum I get so hungry looking at pics lol.
Very good crispy as well. Not high in sodium and tasty. I would be making this one again for Family and friends
Very good for such a simple recipe. Will make again
I like this recipe is the first one I tried from this website and one of my favorites...
I would recommend doubling the recipe. I added 2-3 tsp of all purpose. Very tasty. Will make again
Used whatever recipe I had in hand, baked chicken in pre heated oven per instructions and meat turned out so soft! Great guide for baking chicken!

Made exactly as recipe asked. Very easy and quick to prepare. 
This is an excellent dish and is now one of my favorite wing dishes.
Loved it! I would add a little heat to it like Sriracha sauce next time..
